short-title.#text:
Denying Firearms and Explosives to
			 Dangerous Terrorists Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Short title

Granting the Attorney General the authority
			 to deny the sale, delivery, or transfer of a firearm or the issuance of a
			 firearms or explosives license or permit to dangerous terrorists

header.#text:
Attorney General discretionary denial of
			 Federal firearms licenses

text.#text: by adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may deny a license
				application if the Attorney General determines that the applicant (including
				any responsible person) is known (or appropriately suspected) to be or have
				been engaged in conduct constituting, in preparation for, in aid of, or related
				to terrorism, or providing material support or resources for terrorism, and the
				Attorney General has a reasonable belief that the applicant may use a firearm
				in connection with
				terrorism.

current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To increase public safety by permitting the
		  Attorney General to deny the transfer of firearms or the issuance of firearms
		  and explosives licenses to known or suspected dangerous
		  terrorists.
